author: Anonymous Atom
title: Module 9a: The argument
question:
I am confused as to why the answer is third and not the first answer? 
The explanation still confuses me, I saw someone explain the reduction step quite better than the videos on edX; thus, I was hoping for a different explanation that could help me understand this better! 
Screenshot_2022-03-08_11.03.49.png
student_answer: The condition of cutoff > 0 is necessary because division by 3 will never result in 0 or a number smaller than 0. The condition of s >= 0 is necessary so that you don't make a square with length -3.
